front.title: Fast Router Discovery with L2 support

abstract.t: For efficient Detecting Network Attachment (DNA), a host should quickly receive a Router Advertisement (RA) message upon a new link- layer connection. This draft presents a quick RA acquisition scheme with the support of a link-layer entity, Point of Attachment (PoA). Upon a new network attachment, the PoA may either trigger an Access Router (AR) to immediately send an unicast RA, "RA Triggering" or send such an RA for itself, "RA Proxying". We may put "RA Triggering" or "RA Proxying" functionality on a PoA to get the optimized result without IPv6 standard change.
